required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Bakircay University Cigli Training and Research Hospital
clinical_study.official_title: Bakircay University Cigli Training and Research Hospital

lead_sponsor.agency: Recep Tayyip Erdogan University Training and Research Hospital

clinical_study.source: Recep Tayyip Erdogan University Training and Research Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of the study is to investigate the oncological outcomes of obturator nerve blockade in patients with lateral wall localized non-muscle invasive bladder cancer

detailed_description.textblock: Patient divided into two group.First group includes patients underwent TUR-BT under only spinal anesthesia and second group includes patients underwent TUR-BT under spinal anesthesia combined with ultrasound guided obturator nerve blockade.

primary_outcome.description: Reccurens or progression of tumor was recorded

arm_group.description: Patients underwent TUR-BT under spinal anesthesia
Patients underwent TUR-BT under spinal anesthesia combined with ultrasound guided obturator nerve blockade

intervention.description: We performed spinal anesthesia combined with ultrasound guided obturator nerve blockade according to the localization of bladder cancer in patients with lateral wall localized non-muscle invasive bladder cancer

study_pop.textblock: Patients diagnosed with lateral wall localized non muscle invasive bladder cancer underwent TUR-BT under spinal anesthesia combined with ultrasound guided obturator nerve blockade

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients with lateral wall localized non muscle invasive bladder cancer
Exclusion Criteria:
- history of previous TUR-BT
- diagnosis of non-urothelial carcinoma
- coagulopathy
- history of allergic reaction to the local anesthtetic agent
- presence of muscle-invasive bladder cancer
- history of chemotherapy or radiotherapy before TUR-BT
- precence of variant histopathology
- using bipolar energy for the resection of bladder tumor
- presence of concomittant upper urothelial tract urothelial carcinoma
- patients with the neuromusculer disease
- pregnancy
- history of medication effecting immune system

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Recep Tayyip Erdogan University Training and Research Hospital
responsible_party.investigator_title: Bakircay University Cigli Training and Research Hospital
